uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.osgi

Interface ServiceWrapperManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.osgi.framework.hooks.service.EventListenerHook, org.osgi.framework.hooks.service.FindHook
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServiceWrapperManagerImpl

    public interface ServiceWrapperManager
extends org.osgi.framework.hooks.service.EventListenerHook, org.osgi.framework.hooks.service.FindHook
    Adding and removing service wrappers from this manager should see their effects applied to all services within the OSGi service registry this manager is registered with.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String SUPPORTS_WRAP_EXISTING_SERVICES
      If a property with this key is present on a ServiceWrapperManager service then the value should be of the type Boolean.

    • Field Detail

      • SUPPORTS_WRAP_EXISTING_SERVICES

        static final java.lang.String SUPPORTS_WRAP_EXISTING_SERVICES

        If a property with this key is present on a ServiceWrapperManager service then the value should be of the type Boolean. This value then determines whether a wrapper be applied retroactively to services which already exist, and therefore may already be in use by other bundles.

        Wrappers which maintain state should normally not set this value to Boolean.TRUE, as they won't generally have any way to determine the state they should adopt at the point at which they are added, since they may be added and removed multiple times, through multiple calls to ServiceWrapper.wrapService(Object).

        If this property is set to Boolean.FALSE then existing services will not be wrapped, so the wrapper can be sure that ServiceWrapper.wrapService(Object) is only ever called once for any service, at the point when that services is registered.

        Implementations of ServiceWrapperManager may choose to not accept or to ignore wrappers with this property set to true, as it may be necessary to incur a slight overhead over the entire service-framework in order to support this feature (all services may need to be proxied preemptively). It should also be noted that an implementation of ServiceWrapperManager may only be able to wrap services which were registered after the manager was registered or created itself.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addServiceWrapper

        void addServiceWrapper(ServiceWrapper<?> serviceWrapper,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> serviceProperties)
        Add a wrapper to the manager. Existing services may be wrapped at this point according to the configuration of the wrapper.
        Parameters:
        serviceWrapper - The ServiceWrapper instance to register.
        serviceProperties - The service properties of the service wrapper.

      • modifyServiceWrapper

        void modifyServiceWrapper(ServiceWrapper<?> serviceWrapper,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> serviceProperties)
        Unregister a service wrapper from the manager. The effects of the new properties will be propagated immediately to any wrapping services as appropriate.
        Parameters:
        serviceWrapper - The ServiceWrapper instance to update.
        serviceProperties - The updated service properties of the service wrapper.

      • removeServiceWrapper

        void removeServiceWrapper(ServiceWrapper<?> serviceWrapper)
        Unregister a service wrapper from the manager. This will have the side effect of removing all instances of wrapped services from the service registry, which could mean services in use are removed.
        Parameters:
        serviceWrapper - The ServiceWrapper instance to unregister.
